title: How Outrage at Kimmel Grew to a Shout From a Whisper
summary: Right-wing users on social media on Tuesday were frustrated but not yet apoplectic about Jimmy Kimmel’s monologue. Things changed.

title: What Is ‘Consequence Culture’?
summary: As some prominent conservatives target both ordinary people and public figures for their comments about Charlie Kirk, they are trying to rebrand a practice they once maligned.

title: Trump Pressures Broadcasters Over Critical Coverage, Escalating Attack on Speech
summary: The president’s suggestion that broadcasters should lose their licenses because of criticism of him indicated that his assault on critics’ language is driven in part by personal animus.

title: F.C.C. Head Says Kimmel Not ‘the Last Shoe to Drop,’ and Musk Goes All In on A.I.
summary: Plus, your Friday news quiz.

title: Battered but Undefeated, Hamas Remains a Fighting Force in Gaza
summary: Some Israeli officials believe the military assault on Gaza City will deliver a decisive blow to the group, which continues to stage ambushes and guerrilla attacks.

title: RFK Jr.’s Vaccine Committee to Vote on Hepatitis B and Covid Shots
summary: The members voted against the combination shot for measles, mumps, rubella and chickenpox. Guidelines on vaccines given separately to prevent those infections remain unchanged.

title: What Charlie Kirk Could Mean for the Future of Marriage and Family
summary: Erika Kirk said her husband aspired to “revive the American family.” Conservative activists wonder if Charlie Kirk’s legacy will lend new urgency to White House policy discussions.

title: ‘Peak SF’ on a Friday Night Is a Robot Fight
summary: The artificial intelligence boom, which has brought techies flocking back to the city, has fueled a resurgence of live — and sometimes futuristic — events.

title: Autocrats Move Quickly to Fill Void as Trump Retreats From U.N.
summary: As President Trump pulls back U.S. funding of the United Nations, countries like China, Russia and Qatar are seeking to influence the body’s work on human rights and labor.

title: How China Stands to Gain as the U.S. Steps Away From the U.N.
summary: U.S. funding cuts are straining the United Nations and giving Beijing an opening to strengthen its influence, at a fraction of the cost Washington once paid.

title: Political Violence Isn’t New. But Something About This Moment Is.
summary: Charlie Kirk’s assassination fits into American history. How does it fit into our politics?

title: Texas A&M President to Step Down After Controversy Over ‘Gender Ideology’
summary: The university had been roiled after a student filmed herself arguing with the instructor of a children’s literature course that recognized more than two genders.

title: How Xi Is Using a TikTok Tradeoff to Court Trump
summary: Agreeing to a deal suggests that the fate of TikTok matters less to Beijing than gaining leverage on issues it cares most about, like tariffs, technology and Taiwan.

title: Trump and Xi Set to Finalize TikTok Deal
summary: The two leaders are expected to speak Friday to discuss a deal to keep the wildly popular app from going dark in the United States.

title: Draft Bill Would Authorize Trump to Wage Drug Trafficking War
summary: The potential legislation would grant President Trump sweeping power to use military force if he saw a link to “narco-terrorists.”

title: Democrats Seek to Limit Trump’s War Powers After Venezuela Boat Strikes
summary: Lawmakers have said that President Trump has not provided sufficient evidence about the threat posed by the vessels or the legal basis to use force against them.

title: Taliban Rebuffs Trump’s Effort to Regain Air Base in Afghanistan
summary: An Afghan official rejected the idea of a renewed presence for the U.S. military in the country, but left the door open for “political and economic relations.”

title: The Race Is on to Make Rare Earth Magnets Outside China
summary: After Beijing exerted its power over the valuable magnets as leverage, other countries started to add production, but only incrementally. And China is far ahead.

title: The Plot to Free the Nuns
summary: The last of their order, they are now known for a dispute with the church they gave their lives to over where to live in retirement. And they wanted to stay home.

title: Flattery and Flourish for Trump. For His U.K. Hosts, Relief at Avoiding Strife.
summary: The president was feted by King Charles III with the sort of pageantry he covets, signed a technology deal and steered clear of big disagreements with Prime Minister Keir Starmer.

title: The Trump Administration’s Chilling Efforts to Punish Free Speech
summary: If the American ideal of freedom means anything, it is that we can engage in an extremely wide range of political speech, including the tasteless and the offensive.

title: Spencer Cox Wants to Pull Our Politics Back From the Brink
summary: The Utah governor is trying to model a different kind of leadership in a very dangerous political moment.

title: 32 Years After a Brutal Murder, a Man Is on Trial. Again.
summary: A judge vacated the convictions of two men accused of killing Deborah Meindl in her Tonawanda, N.Y., home. The district attorney is trying to convict them once more.

title: ‘Harrowing Beyond Description’: Dozens Killed While at Prayer in Sudan
summary: A doctor who spoke with The Times last week was among those killed when a missile hit a mosque on Friday as paramilitaries stepped up their brutal siege of the city of El Fasher.

title: The F.J. King, a Ship Lost in 1886, Is Found in Lake Michigan
summary: Long rumored to be on the floor of the lake but never seen, the schooner had eluded divers and taunted storytellers for generations. It was miles off the Door Peninsula in Wisconsin.
